nodes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Unsigned math operations with safety checks that revert on error
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two unsigned integers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation: @dev Adds two unsigned integers, reverts on overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Divides two unsigned integers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
nodes.name: mod

nodes.documentation:
@title ERC20 interface
@dev see https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20
nodes.name: IERC20

nodes.documentation:
@title Standard ERC20 token
 * @dev Implementation of the basic standard token.
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-20.md
Originally based on code by FirstBlood:
https://github.com/Firstbloodio/token/blob/master/smart_contract/FirstBloodToken.sol
 * This implementation emits additional Approval events, allowing applications to reconstruct the allowance status for
all accounts just by listening to said events. Note that this isn't required by the specification, and other
compliant implementations may not do it.
nodes.name: ERC20

nodes.documentation: @dev Total number of tokens in existence
nodes.name: totalSupply
balanceOf
allowance
transfer
approve
transferFrom
increaseAllowance
decreaseAllowance
_transfer
_mint
_burn
_burnFrom

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Insufficient ERC20 token balance for delivery."

arguments.value: Insufficient ERC20 token balance for delivery.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Insufficient ERC20 token balance for delivery."
